author: Special Correspondent
text:
Prof. S.M. Ramasamy, former Vice-Chancellor of Gandhigram Rural University, Dindigul, and P. Subas Chandra Bose, former Controller of Examinations of Bharathidasan University, Tiruchi, were unanimously elected as Syndicate Members from among the Senate Members at the 33rd Senate Meeting of Alagappa University, here on Tuesday.

Both were the alumni of Alagappa institutions. Prof Ramasamy has served as Senate Member and Syndicate Member of Bharathidasan University. As one of the leading scientists in the area of remote sensing and earth sciences, he has established the Centre for Excellence in remote sensing in the university.

Prof Bose, former Professor and Head, Postgraduate and Research Department of Tamil, Bishop Heber College, Tiruchi, had served as Controller of Examinations of Bharathidasan University in Tiruchi from 1998 to 2001.

He was the member of Syndicate of Alagappa University and member of the Vice-Chancellor Officiating Committee. He has over 33 years of teaching experience and 15 years of university administrative experience, a release from the university said.
title: Syndicate members of Alagappa University elected
